HValueManager

Simple value syncronization system.

Designed as single instance, depends on HValue and HControl.

The system relies heavily on HValue instances.  It allows easy value syncronization between the server and client components.  HTransporter makes toXML calls whenever it’s making a server poll to send changed data to the server as XML, accessable by the ‘HSyncData’ request key.

See Also

HValue HTransporter HControl

Simple usage example

var myApp = new HApplication(100);
var myTextCtrl1 = new HTextControl(new HRect(100,100,356,118),myApp,'',"Hello, I'm a textcontrol!");
myTextCtrl1.draw();
var myTextCtrl2 = new HTextControl(new HRect(120,100,356,138),myApp,'',"Hi, I'm also a textcontrol!");
myTextCtrl2.draw();
var myNewHValue = new HValue('foo123', "Hi, I am an example value.");
myNewValue.bind( myTextCtrl1 );
myNewValue.bind( myTextCtrl2 );
HValueManager.set('foo123',"Hi, I am the new replacement value!");
var myXMLChanged = HValueManager.toXML();
Summary
HValueManager
Simple value syncronization system.
Instance variables
add
Adds a new HValue bound to the value of id into the value index of HValueManager.
set
Sets a new container value to the HValue object by calling the bound HValue by its id.
del
Deletes the HValue by id from the value management system.
changed
Reports the HValue to HValueManager as a changed object.
toXML
Outputs all changed values to XML.

Instance variables

valuesArray, contains all values currently managed, accessible by HValue id:s
tosyncArray, contains changed values that need to be reported to the remote side via HTransporter
isSendingflag, is set to true when HTransporter is busy.

add

add: function(_id,
_obj)

Adds a new HValue bound to the value of id into the value index of HValueManager.  These values will then then be automatically syncronized between components and other compatible instances, like server-side value management.  Most likely to be called from inside a HValue constructor.

Parameters

_idAn id for the value, doesn’t really matter at the client-side as long as it is unique.  Matters for server-side.  Could be int or str, depending on the server implementation.
_objA HValue object instance, usually this inside constructors of HValue-compatible classes.

See also

set del HValue.constructor

set

set: function(_id,
_value)

Sets a new container value to the HValue object by calling the bound HValue by its id.

Parameters

_idThe HValue-instance id to be modified.
_valueThe container value (NOT a HValue)

See also

add del HValue.set HControl.setValue

del

del: function(_id)

Deletes the HValue by id from the value management system.

Parameters

_idThe HValue-instance id to be deleted.

See also

add set HValue

changed

changed: function(_theObj)

Reports the HValue to HValueManager as a changed object.  It adds a reference to the HValue, unless the value is changed via HTransporter.

There is no need to call it manually, except when creating a new HValue -compatible object from the scratch.  Value-classes call changed whenever the change needs to be reported elsewhere.

Parameters

_theObjThe HValue -instance object to list as changed.

See also

<isGetting> tosync set

toXML

toXML: function()

Outputs all changed values to XML.

See also

HTransporter

add: function(_id,
_obj)
Adds a new HValue bound to the value of id into the value index of HValueManager.
Data that needs to be syncronized between components or remote clients should be implemented as HValues.

Abstract foundation class for all active visual components that implement events and values.
Simple mid-level AJAX communication system.

_value)
set: function(_value)
Replaces the data of the value.

Assigns the object a new value.
